entry.title: Gradle QuickStart
entry.content:
Gradle is an open source build automation system that builds upon the concepts of Apache Ant and Apache Maven and introduces a Groovy-based domain-specific language (DSL) instead of the XML form used by Apache Maven of declaring the project configuration. Here is its Wiki. And here is official website.

Below is a quickstart guide for Gradle.

Gradle Installation

Here is the link of official document about Gradle install.

For Mac user, it is much easiser:

To test whether gradle is installed successfully, execute this command:

The output should be similar like this:

Gradle Project QuickStart

Here is a quickstart guide to setup a Hello World project.

Create a new folder for project:

Then execute this command to check all the available tasks:

Init a Gradle project:

Edit build.gradle file:

Now a simple gradle script is done. We can execute the “hello” task through this command:

The -q option will remove the debug message output.

Below is the source code of this project.
Github Source Code.
entry.summary: Gradle is an open source build automation system that builds upon the concepts of Apache Ant and Apache Maven and introduces a Groovy-bas

entry.title: MongoDB Install on Centos
entry.content:
Here is the official document to install MongoDB on CentOS / RedHat OS.

Below is a simple version of install guide.

Configure the yum

Create a /etc/yum.repos.d/mongodb-org-3.2.repo file so that we can install MongoDB directly, using yum.

Copy following content into the repository file:

Install MongoDB and associated tools

Execute following command to install MongoDB:

Run MongoDB Service

Before we start MongoDB Service, we may have to configure SELinux first.

Check /etc/selinux/config. The value of variable SELINUX has these three options:

If it is in enforcing mode, we may have to execute this command to ensure that MongoDB can use the port:

Or we can change the SELINUX into different mode and reboot the system so that change can take effect.

By default, MongoDB save data files in /var/lib/mongo and save log files in /var/log/mongodb. All these settigs can be changed in /etc/mongod.conf.

To start MongoDB, execute this command:

To stop MongoDB, execute this command:

Verify MongoDB Boosting

Check /var/log/mongodb/mongod.log to find the following lines:

where is the port configured in /etc/mongod.conf and 27017 is by default.

Or ensure that MongoDB will start following a system reboot by issuing the following command::

Remove MongoDB

After stop MongoDB, execute this command:

And then remove data files as well as log files:

entry.title: Lua Install QuickStart
entry.content:
Lua is a lightweight multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded systems and clients, and is cross-platform since it is written in ANSI C and has a relatively simple C API.

Here is the official website of Lua.

Here is a simple guide to download, build and install Lua on Centos.

Download Lua

Check this page to get the latest version of Lua.
Use this command to download Lua-5.3.2:

Build Lua

Execute following commands:

If we meet readline.h not found issues, execute this command to install the missing packages:

Install Lua

Execute this command:

By default, Lua will be installed under /usr/local folder. We can check Makefile to change installation information.

If Lua is installed successfully, this command will be executed successfully:
entry.summary: Lua is a lightweight multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded systems and clients, and is cross-platform since

entry.title: Hackerrank InterviewStreet Algorithm Problem Solution List Bit Manipulation
entry.content:
Here are the solutions of some of the algorithm problems post in Hackerrank / InterviewStreet algorithm domain. The explanation of solution may not be detailed but every one can view my code in github. This page will be updated in any time.

Here is the summary of solution list.

Xor-sequence

Problem
Code
A kind of construction problem. At first, figure out the pattern which is a repeating sequence: 0,1,2,2,6,7,0,0. And then calculate the result based on the given position.
entry.summary: Here are the solutions of some of the algorithm problems post in

Bear and Steady Gene

Problem
Code
A kind of two pointer problem. Using two pointer to form a sliding window that contain the number of extra characters with the minimal size.

entry.title: Debug Java Program in Eclipse Tutorial
Hackerrank Data Structure Problem Solution List IV
entry.content:
Here is the summary of Hackerrank data structure problem solution list.
summary list

Below is the detailed explanation of the idea behind solution.

Merging communities

Problem Link
Code Link
Data structure problem. Use union find data structure to simulate the process.

Components in a graph

Problem Link
Code Link
DFS problem. Just use DFS to count the number of nodes of the connected components.

Data Structures MCQ 1

Problem Link
Answer: n - 1

Data Structures MCQ 2

Problem Link
Answer: segment tree

Data Structures MCQ 3

Problem Link
Answer: Stack

Contact

Problem Link
Code Link
Data structure and DP problem. Use DP with Trie as data structure. Pre-calculate the number of substrings of dictionary and dp[i] is the number of substrings that ends with ith node of Trie tree. So for any given string, if it can be found as a subtring of any strings on the dictionary, return the corresponding dp[i].

No Prefix Set

Problem Link
Code Link.
Data structure problem. Just use Trie tree to simulate the process.
entry.summary:
Here is the summary of Hackerrank data structure problem solution list.
summary list

Below is the detailed explanation of the idea behind solution.

entry.title: Redis QuickStart
entry.content:
Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store fro database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries and bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
Here is the official website of redis.

Below is a simple quick start tutorial of redis. And here is the official tutorial.

Install Redis

We can go to official website to download the software. Or execute the command below:

Then move the tarball to the directory where we want to save the software and then extract it there.

Now go to redis-stable directory and build the software:

To build Redis, we need to install gcc and g++ on the machine.
After that, we can copy the following two executable files to proper places:

Or just execute:

At last, set these two executable files into PATH environment variable.

Run Redis Server

At first, let us see the five main executable files under src folder:

So to start Redis server, just run this command:

If the server starts successfully, we can see similar output in terminal as follows:

To shutdown the server, just press ‘ctrl + c’ and we will see this output:

Run Redis Client

To start Redis client, execute this command:

Here is a small test below:
entry.summary:
Redis is an open source, in-memory data structure store fro database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries and bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
Here is the official website of redis.

Below is a simple quick start tutorial of redis. And here is the official tutorial.

entry.title: MongoDB Quick Start on Mac
entry.content:
Here is the tutorial about how to install and run MonogoDB on mac. Below is the link of official document:
official document

Install MongoDB

There are multiple ways to install MOngoDB on Mac. Here we use Homebrew to install it.
At first, we should install Homebrew if we do not have one running on Mac. Execute this command:

To test whether it is installed successfully, run this command:

And output should be similar as follows:

If we have already installed one, update it through this command:

And then install MongoDB binaries using this command:

or build MongoDB from source with TLS/SSL support:

or install the latest development release of MongoDB through this command:

Init MongoDB

To init MongoDB, we should at first create a data directory for it:

/data/db is default data directory, but here I create a different data directory:

And then set permission for that directory, the most brute force approach is as follows (not recommended):

Run MongoDB

If the system PATH variable includes the location of mongod binary, and data directory is the default one, then use this command:

If the system PATH variable does not include the location of mongod binary, and data directory is the default one, use this command instead:

If the system PATH variable includes the location of mongod binary, and data directory is not the default one, then use this command:

So for me, the command is this one:

If MongoDB is running successfully, the output of terminal is similar as follows:

We can visit this URL: http://localhost:27017/ from the browser.
entry.summary:
Here is the tutorial about how to install and run MonogoDB on mac. Below is the link of official document:
official document
